reviews.review: Отличная игра, которая погружает вас в свою атмосферу с головой. Увлекательные локации, заставляющие поломать голову. Интересный сюжет. Харизматичные герои. Всем советую хоть раз поиграть в эту игру, и она не оставит вас равнодушными :)

Tamam belki de her oyunu tavsiye ediyorum ama Portal 2 kesinlikle ayrı bir yere sahip. 
İlk oyunu oynayın alakalı, oynamayın alakasız diyorlar. Portal da güzel bir oyun ve oynarsanız bir şey kaybetmezsiniz. 
Biraz daha oyun içine değinmek gerekirse bu oyunla Aperture Science'ı iyice keşfediyoruz. En alttan en üste kadar çıkıyoruz. Oynanırlık açısından bakarsak ilk oyuna çok şey katılmış. Değişik engeller ve yöntemler var. Senaryo modu oldukça uzun. Ama senaryo bitince de ortada kalmıyorsunuz. Multiplayer modu çok iyi hazırlanmış. Kendi test odalarınızı tasarlayabiliyorsunuz. Daha bir sürü seçenek var.

Oynamadıysanız çok şey kaçırıyorsunuz.

Valve como siempre no decepciona y este juego denota esmero asi como cuidado en cada detalle. Necesitas jugar el primer juego o la histora te parecera extraña. Si tienes un amigo que tambien juega podras pasar otra historia en modo cooperativo.

An insanely fun and addicting game. Sometimes the puzzles can get difficult and time consuming, and a few times it can get annoying having just completed one puzzle and then immediately getting thrown into another one (especially involving the gels) but the game is fun, much longer than the first, and even the plottwist was pretty good, despite its slight predictability. Overall, I strongly suggest you try it at least once.
You should own this game, top 10 all-time games.

Let me just say right off the bat:
[b]JESUS IS THIS GAME AMAZING[/b]
As you can tell from that thoughtful sentence, this game has left a mark on the gaming industry, [strike]like I did on my bully from the first school[/strike]. Its inivative campain and mechanics dont just rely on Portals, but many other things that ill leave you to discover. This game appeals to a large audience, which Valve like to do. Its dark humor and story, its mind exploding puzzles, and the amazing voice acting! I went to see Wheatly at a stage after playing this. This detailed environment will, and I repeat, [I]will[I] leave a bit of memory in your brain, its truely worth $20, if not $40.
My verdict?
[b]GET THIS GAME NOW OR I WILL MURDER YER FACE OFF[/b]

This game has to be one of the best games i have ever played. it has an amazing story line that goes well with the innovative gaming mechanics. Overall this game is a must have, and definitely a must play.

When jumping into Portal 2 it is very important to remember one thing...it's a sequel. With that knowledge in mind, we can answer a few key questions:

1. Will it achieve the same level of originality as the first?
2. Will it strike the player as equally as intriguing as the first?
3. Will it offer a story as witty and wonderfully constructed as the first?
4. Will it be as good as the first?

In my humble opinion the answer to these questions is as follows:

1. It'll try.
2. Yes-ish
3. Sort of.
4. Definitely not.

The fact is, Portal is the greatest video game ever created. There are simply too many wonderful things to say about the original game, and hardly anything negative to add. However, the sequel has made the mistake of giving plenty of negative things to mention. Too often does the player find themselves in a room of empty space. Grand, yes, and very open, sure. A wonderful showing-off of the Aperture Science labs, but lacking in motivation. It's not much fun to just walk around looking for the one place on the wall that's lit up and able to hold a portal. The game consists of too much, "Where next?" and not enough "How do I get to there?"

There is the added element of the gels, and this is a wonderful new feature that adds a whole new dimension to the gameplay. That being said; I found them to be a bit underused, not even being introduced until somewhere between half-way and three-quarters of the way through the game.

The story is great, don't get me wrong. Of course, it's pretty hard to mess up the perfection of the story the first game presented. I really enjoyed how, though the game was a sequel, the player was taken through history in order to answer the questions that led up to the events of the first game. In this way the sequel acts more like a prequel, and that's something that I think should be praised. Certainly the new cast of characters (specifically Wheatley) is worth mentioning, and they add a wonderful new level to the game as well. 

Ultimately however, I feel like the first game was a happy accident. A side project that ended up being the greatest thing Valve has done. Whereas, with the sequel, they knew exactly what they were getting into. They knew that, no matter what, their creation would be met with great admiration and excitement. Quite frankly, there was no way Portal 2 could fail. Through a combination of (dare I say) over funding and over ambition, coupled with the knowledge that failure would not be a possibility, Portal 2 attempted to take Portal 1 to new heights....but instead falls a little short.

Still, this is a Portal game, and that's enough for me.

Four (and a half) Stars.

Un chef d’œuvre! Le jeu propose des défis de réflexions super intéressants. Je ne parlerai pas du gameplay, tout le monde sait qu'il est excellent. Le moteur Source propose des environnements simples et épurés qui ne vieilliront pas. L'humour du jeu est juste GÉNIAL! Par contre le passage dans les bas fonds d'Aperture ne m'a pas vraiment fait vibrer. La coop est formidable avec un ami. ACHETEZ CE JEU SI VOUS NE L'AVEZ PAS ENCORE FAIT!
Simply said - it's Portal. If you haven't tried it yet (living under a rock) - go get it now. NOW! Yes, right now! Sell your kidney or your sister if you have no money.

Portal 2 is without a shadow of a doubt one of the best video-games I've ever played. It's an outstanding continuation of Portal 1 which outdoes its predecessor introducing new elements to interact with. The puzzles are fun, the scenarios are incredible, the dialogues are utterly brilliant and on top of everything there's a fantastic story which I absolutely loved.

You don't need to have played Portal 1 to have fun with Portal 2, but in my opinion if you want to really enjoy it you ought to play Portal 1 first and go through the whole story.

One thing to say about this game: Fantastic!
All I can really say if I had to sum it up in one word. I just absolutely love this game.
The entire story was absolutely perfect. Portal 2 made me go on a turret collection and the characters; just loved them, every single one from Wheatley to Cave Johnson. Every. Single. One. Their personalities were made just perfectly even for their expressionless robotic appearence (although Wheatley had many expressions thanks to his robotic eyelids and blue orb). The voice acting was great and played with my emotions through out the entire game. GLaDOS and Wheatley made me laugh, cry, and hate with a burning passion.
There is even a Co-op version of this game, even though you and your partner may have difficulties when solving these tests; WHAT this Co-op experience does it that it tests HOW you and your partner get along in frustrating and difficult situations and WHY you have difficulties with eachother.
Sounds like a good therapy session, don't you think? 
I love this game.
I loved how at first I saw the game as all science and nothing to do with what happened behind aperture, and what they kept behind all those A.I. machineries. Just playing through the whole thing and discovering the darker side of the Aperture Enrichment center literally stopped me from everything else; taking breaks to figure out WHAT happened, HOW it happened, and WHY it happened. The tests made me think more than anything, even more than an SOL would, and plus fun was added and 2x frustration into the thoughts. Puzzles are what this game gives and the storyline will make you think WHAT, HOW, and WHY all at once. I was fascinated by all Portal 2 provided and it even made me cry at some points but that's just me. Portal 2 made me want to play it over and over again so I could find what I could've missed and so far, since I also have it on Xbox360, I've played it only a total of 16 times. If you really want a game that makes you think and discover secrets and have a moronic yet hilarious companion who has a great and reassuring way of speaking (AKA someone like an A.I. named Wheatley) Then just get Portal 2 and play through the whole thing, play it over and over so you can find WHAT you could have missed, HOW you could find it, and WHY it means that much to you.
This is my first review but take my word for it and play this game.
Portal 2 is FANTASTIC!

But you shoud buy it!

Hola, aqui presento mi analisis en todos los aspectos de Portal 2:

Grafico: Tiene un gran detallado grafico, en el que podemos observar el gran potencial que puede llegar a tener el motor Source. En resumen, una buena iluminación y sombreado, buenas texturas, y unos shaders de detalle bastante logrado (10/10)
Jugabilidad: Este juego destaca sobre todo por su inmensa jugabilidad. Con el Dispositivo Portatil de Portales, con el que podemos hacer dos Portales (se entra por uno y se sale por el otro, facil mecanica de juego), y podemos usarlo para resolver puzlez, teniendo que aprovechar los elementos de nuestro entorno y las propias propiedades fisicas, le dan a este juego una amplia jugabilidad a la que le doy un (10/10).
Argumento: El argumento esta tambien bastante logrado, aunque el juego no este centrado en el mismo totalmente, si no más en lo que viene a ser en la resolución de los puzzles impuestos por nuestra querida "amiga" GLaDOS. En mi opinión, podrian haberse centrado un poco más en el argumento, dando más detalles historicos de Aperture, e involucrandonos un poco más profundamente en todo lo que rodea a esta empresa, y a los experiemntos que hacen (como por ejemplo, ¿porque experimentan con el dispositivo de portales, con que fín? son preguntas que se me quedan en el tintero). (7.5/10)
Multijugador: Tambien bastante logrado, el modo cooperativo añade mucha más versatibilidad a la jugabilidad de este título, ya que necesitamos usar en algunos puzzles hasta los 4 portales, y tendremos que jugar con una cooperación tanto cronologica como espacial, para poder superar puzzles. (9.5/10)
Por ultimo decir que la posibilidad que nos da el juego de crear nuestras camaras y de jugar las de los demas, hacen que este juego sea prácticamente infinito, y nos permita poder jugarlo y disfrutarlo mucho más alla del modo historia y cooperatico. Finalmente decir, que en mi opinión, este juego es de 10 sobre 10, y definible por una simple palabra: IMPRESIONANTE.
